Public MustInherit Class DictionaryBase Implements IDictionary
public ref class DictionaryBase abstract : System::Collections::IDictionary
type DictionaryBase = class interface IDictionary interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

summary.span: 为键/值对的强类型集合提供 基类。

span.span: Provides the base class for a strongly typed collection of key/value pairs.

remarks.format: ## Remarks （适用于在 Visual Basic 中的每个） 的 C# 语言的 foreach 语句返回集合中的元素的类型的对象。The foreach statement of the C# language (for each in Visual Basic) returns an object of the type of the elements in the collection. 由于每个元素的是一个键/值对，元素类型不是键的类型或值的类型。Since each element of the is a key/value pair, the element type is not the type of the key or the type of the value. 相反，元素类型是。Instead, the element type is . `foreach`语句是只允许读取、 不写入集合的枚举器周围的包装。The `foreach` statement is a wrapper around the enumerator, which only allows reading from, not writing to, the collection. > [!NOTE] > 因为密钥可以被继承，但不能更改其行为，使用的比较保证其绝对唯一性方法。Because keys can be inherited and their behavior changed, their absolute uniqueness cannot be guaranteed by comparisons using the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现类，并使用该实现若要创建的字典键和值的有小于或等于的 5 个字符。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

threadsafe.span: 公共静态 (在 Visual Basic 中) 的此类型的成员是线程安全。

span.span: Public static ( in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 但不保证所有实例成员都是线程安全的。

span.span: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 此实现不提供同步的 （线程安全） 包装，但是，派生的类可以创建他们自己的同步的版本使用属性。

span.span: This implementation does not provide a synchronized (thread-safe) wrapper for a , but derived classes can create their own synchronized versions of the using the property.

threadsafe.span: 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。

span.span: Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

span.para: 此基类提供轻松实现器来创建强类型化的自定义集合。建议来扩展此基类而不是创建其自己的实施者。此基类的成员受到保护，并且可用于通过派生类使用。

This base class is provided to make it easier for implementers to create a strongly typed custom collection. Implementers are encouraged to extend this base class instead of creating their own. Members of this base class are protected and are intended to be used through a derived class only.

span.span: Copies the elements to a one-dimensional at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将元素复制到枚举器循环访问的相同顺序。The elements are copied to the in the same order in which the enumerator iterates through the . 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is .

exception.span: 源 中的元素数目大于从 到目标 末尾之间的可用空间。

span.span: The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from to the end of the destination .

exception.span: 源 的类型无法自动转换为目标 的类型。

span.span: The type of the source cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination .

summary.span: 返回循环访问 实例的 。

span.span: Returns an that iterates through the instance.
An for the instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现类，并使用该实现若要创建的字典键和值的有小于或等于的 5 个字符。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

summary.span: 在清除 实例的内容之前执行其他自定义进程。

span.span: Performs additional custom processes before clearing the contents of the instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的默认实现需要通过要清除的集合之前执行某些操作的派生类中重写。The default implementation of this method is intended to be overridden by a derived class to perform some action before the collection is cleared. 仅在返回的实例上调用 On \* 方法属性，但不能对返回的实例属性。The On\* methods are invoked only on the instance returned by the property, but not on the instance returned by the property. 此方法的默认实现是 o （1） 操作。The default implementation of this method is an O(1) operation.

span.para: 此方法允许实施必须定义从基础删除所有元素之前。通过定义此方法，实现者可以向继承的方法添加功能，而无需重写所有其他方法。 而标准的清除行为之前调用标准清除行为之后调用。例如，实施者可以免除从通过全局清除删除某些元素。

This method allows implementers to define processes that must be performed before deleting all the elements from the underlying . By defining this method, implementers can add functionality to inherited methods without having to override all other methods. is invoked before the standard Clear behavior, whereas is invoked after the standard Clear behavior. For example, implementers can exempt certain elements from deletion by a global Clear.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnClearComplete ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnClearComplete() cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnClearComplete ()
protected: virtual void OnClearComplete();
abstract member OnClearComplete : unit -> unit override this.OnClearComplete : unit -> unit

span.para: 此方法允许实施必须定义从基础中删除所有元素后。通过定义此方法，实现者可以向继承的方法添加功能，而无需重写所有其他方法。 而标准的清除行为之前调用标准清除行为之后调用。

This method allows implementers to define processes that must be performed after deleting all the elements from the underlying . By defining this method, implementers can add functionality to inherited methods without having to override all other methods. is invoked before the standard Clear behavior, whereas is invoked after the standard Clear behavior.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的默认实现返回`currentValue`。The default implementation of this method returns `currentValue`. 它旨在由派生类检索指定的元素时执行其他操作中重写。It is intended to be overridden by a derived class to perform additional action when the specified element is retrieved. 仅在返回的实例上调用 On \* 方法属性，但不能对返回的实例属性。The On\* methods are invoked only on the instance returned by the property, but not on the instance returned by the property. 此方法的默认实现是 o （1） 操作。The default implementation of this method is an O(1) operation.

span.para: 此方法允许实施者定义所执行的基础的标准 Get 行为时必须执行过程的。通过定义此方法，实现者可以向继承的方法添加功能，而无需重写所有其他方法。 可用于指定要返回从基础检索到的值之前执行的进程。例如，实施者可以将值转换为其他类型返回之前对其。

This method allows implementers to define processes that must be performed when executing the standard Get behavior of the underlying . By defining this method, implementers can add functionality to inherited methods without having to override all other methods. can be used to specify processes to perform before returning the value retrieved from the underlying . For example, implementers can cast the value into another type before returning it.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnRemoveComplete (object key, object value);

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的默认实现需要重写由派生类中移除指定的元素之后执行某些操作。The default implementation of this method is intended to be overridden by a derived class to perform some action after the specified element is removed. 仅在返回的实例上调用 On \* 方法属性，但不能对返回的实例属性。The On\* methods are invoked only on the instance returned by the property, but not on the instance returned by the property. 此方法的默认实现是 o （1） 操作。The default implementation of this method is an O(1) operation.

span.para: 此方法允许实施者定义必须在从基础删除元素后执行的进程。通过定义此方法，实现者可以向继承的方法添加功能，而无需重写所有其他方法。 而标准的删除行为之前调用标准的删除行为之后调用。

This method allows implementers to define processes that must be performed after removing the element from the underlying . By defining this method, implementers can add functionality to inherited methods without having to override all other methods. is invoked before the standard Set behavior, whereas is invoked after the standard Set behavior. This method allows implementers to define processes that must be performed when executing the standard behavior of the underlying . By defining this method, implementers can add functionality to inherited methods without having to override all other methods. can be used to impose restrictions on the type of objects that are accepted into the collection. The default implementation prevents from being added to or removed from the underlying .

MemberSignature.Value: bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
.property instance bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized
ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean Implements ICollection.IsSynchronized
property bool System::Collections::ICollection::IsSynchronized { bool get(); };

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示对 对象的访问是否同步（线程安全）。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether access to a object is synchronized (thread safe).

value.span: 如果对 对象的访问是同步的（线程安全），则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if access to the object is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个对象不同步。A object is not synchronized. 派生的类可以提供的同步的版本类使用属性。Derived classes can provide a synchronized version of the class using the property. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用属性在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the property during the entire enumeration. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/source2.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/source2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/source2.vb#3)] 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

MemberSignature.Value: object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }
.property instance object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot
ReadOnly Property SyncRoot As Object Implements ICollection.SyncRoot
property System::Object ^ System::Collections::ICollection::SyncRoot { System::Object ^ get(); };

summary.span: 获取一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 对象的访问。

span.span: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to a object.

value.span: 一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 对象的访问。

span.span: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生的类可以提供其自己的同步的版本类使用属性。Derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the class using the property. 同步代码必须在执行操作的属性对象，不是直接在对象。The synchronizing code must perform operations on the property of the object, not directly on the object. 这样可确保对从其他对象派生的集合正确地执行操作。This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. 具体而言，它维护与其他线程可能同时对修改的正确同步对象。Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the object. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用属性在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the property during the entire enumeration. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/source2.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/source2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/source2.vb#3)] 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

span.span: Adds an element with the specified key and value into the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有其状态以及其哈希代码值之间没有关联的对象通常不应作为键。An object that has no correlation between its state and its hash code value should typically not be used as the key. 例如，对象要优于作为键使用的对象。For example, objects are better than objects for use as keys. 此外可以使用属性来添加新元素，通过设置密钥的值中不存在; 例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the ; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果中已存在指定的键，并设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现类，并使用该实现若要创建的字典键和值的有小于或等于的 5 个字符。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，此方法使用集合的对象并上的方法`key`来确定是否`item`存在。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, this method uses the collection’s objects’ and methods on `key` to determine whether `item` exists. 在.NET Framework 的早期版本中，通过进行此判断和方法的`key`参数在集合中的对象。In the earlier versions of the .NET Framework, this determination was made by using the and methods of the `key` parameter on the objects in the collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现类，并使用该实现若要创建的字典键和值的有小于或等于的 5 个字符。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. [!code-cpp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CPP/dictionarybase.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/CS/dictionarybase.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.DictionaryBase#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Collections.DictionaryBase/VB/dictionarybase.vb#1)]

.property instance bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsFixedSize
ReadOnly Property IsFixedSize As Boolean Implements IDictionary.IsFixedSize
property bool System::Collections::IDictionary::IsFixedSize { bool get(); };

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示 对象是否具有固定大小。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether a object has a fixed size.

value.span: 如果 对象具有固定大小，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the object has a fixed size; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合不允许添加或删除元素的集合创建，但允许修改现有元素后。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but does allow the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合只是一个集合与防止添加和移除元素; 的包装器因此，如果在更改基础集合，包括添加或删除的元素，大小固定集合反映了这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

MemberSignature.Value: bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsReadOnly { get; }
.property instance bool System.Collections.IDictionary.IsReadOnly
ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean Implements IDictionary.IsReadOnly
property bool System::Collections::IDictionary::IsReadOnly { bool get(); };

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示 对象是否为只读。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether a object is read-only.

value.span: 如果 对象为只读，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the object is read-only; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 集合是只读的只是一个集合与可防止修改集合; 的包装器因此，如果对基础集合进行更改，只读集合反映了这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用下面的语法通过此属性访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[key]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[key]`. 此外可以使用属性来添加新元素，通过设置密钥的值中不存在; 例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the ; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果中已存在指定的键，并设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 检索此属性的值是 o （1） 的操作;将属性设置也是 o （1） 操作。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation; setting the property is also an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现类，并使用该实现若要创建的字典键和值的有小于或等于的 5 个字符。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a of 5 characters or less. summary.span: 获取包含 对象中的键的 对象。

span.span: Gets an object containing the keys in the object.

value.span: 包含 对象中的键的 对象。

span.span: An object containing the keys in the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 中的键的顺序对象未指定，但它是中的关联值的顺序相同对象返回的属性。The order of the keys in the object is unspecified, but is the same order as the associated values in the object returned by the property. 返回不是静态副本，而是，反过来引用在原始密钥对象。The returned is not a static copy; instead, the refers back to the keys in the original object. 因此，更改为继续才会反映在返回。Therefore, changes to the continue to be reflected in the returned . 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例实现类，并使用该实现若要创建的字典键和值的有属性小于或等于的 5 个字符。The following code example implements the class and uses that implementation to create a dictionary of keys and values that have a property of 5 characters or less. summary.span: 返回循环访问 的 。

span.span: Returns an that iterates through the .
An for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置，调用将引发异常。At this position, calling throws an exception. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，则调用将引发异常。If the last call to returned `false`, calling throws an exception. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 如果集合修改之间并，返回设置为时，该元素，即使该枚举数已经无效。If the collection is modified between and , returns the element that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.
